intro: Ganitrus obtusus, commonly known as the blunt-leaf fern, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes many aquatic and semi-aquatic plants. The plant is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves that are typically dark green and glossy. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in a spadix, typical of the Araceae family. Ganitrus obtusus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in humid environments.
